intro: Sida atrosanguinea, commonly known as black bloodweed, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its soft, hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along riverbanks. Sida atrosanguinea is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
